issue.title: Apply fixes from StyleCI
issue.body:
This pull request applies code style fixes from an analysis carried out by [StyleCI](https://styleci.io).

---

For more information, click [here](https://styleci.io/analyses/zGd5BV).

issue.title: Update dependencies for Laravel 5.6 compatibility
issue.body:
https://github.com/spatie/laravel-html/blob/55a367862d61a46620bc04ec1dd2ae24c16c470e/composer.json#L27

Upgraded my project to Laravel 5.6, but spatie/laravel-html won't come along 😊 Dependencies for 2.12 are still locked at 5.4 and 5.5.

This should fix it:

```
    "require": {
        "php": "^7.0",
        "illuminate/http": "~5.4.0|~5.5.0|~5.6.0",
        "illuminate/support": "~5.4.0|~5.5.0|~5.6.0"
    },
```

Also an option is to just depend on the minimum version:

https://github.com/sebastiaanluca/laravel-router/blob/master/composer.json#L24

This allows your package to be used in any version upwards of the minimum requirement, without having to upgrade whenever a new release comes out. Of course, it can happen something breaks, but since it can be used ahead of time, users can notify you of this in advance.

issue.title: Update dependencies for Laravel 5.6 compatibility
issue.body:
https://github.com/spatie/laravel-html/blob/55a367862d61a46620bc04ec1dd2ae24c16c470e/composer.json#L27

Upgraded my project to Laravel 5.6, but spatie/laravel-html won't come along 😊 Dependencies for 2.12 are still locked at 5.4 and 5.5.

This should fix it:

```
    "require": {
        "php": "^7.0",
        "illuminate/http": "~5.4.0|~5.5.0|~5.6.0",
        "illuminate/support": "~5.4.0|~5.5.0|~5.6.0"
    },
```

Also an option is to just depend on the minimum version:

https://github.com/sebastiaanluca/laravel-router/blob/master/composer.json#L24

This allows your package to be used in any version upwards of the minimum requirement, without having to upgrade whenever a new release comes out. Of course, it can happen something breaks, but since it can be used ahead of time, users can notify you of this in advance.

issue.title: Fix checkbox values
issue.body:
The checkbox input should not pull its _value_ from old/session input - that should only affect whether it is _checked_.

An example: we are displaying a boolean value as a checkbox. The boolean is stored as 0 or 1 in the model. If the boolean is currently 0, then the checkbox will be generated as:
    
    <input type="checkbox" name="name" id="name" value="0">

When this form is posted with the checkbox checked, `name` will be set to `0`... which may be interpreted as false. In this case, the boolean can never be set to true again.

I believe this behaviour started after PR #69 was merged.

When this form is posted with the checkbox checked, `name` will be set to `0`... which may be interpreted as false. In this case, the boolean can never be set to true again.

I believe this behaviour started after PR #69 was merged.

issue.title: Fix checkbox values
issue.body:
The checkbox input should not pull its _value_ from old/session input - that should only affect whether it is _checked_.

An example: we are displaying a boolean value as a checkbox. The boolean is stored as 0 or 1 in the model. If the boolean is currently 0, then the checkbox will be generated as:

When this form is posted with the checkbox checked, `name` will be set to `0`... which may be interpreted as false. In this case, the boolean can never be set to true again.

I believe this behaviour started after PR #69 was merged.

issue.title: Render a Select imput with group-options
issue.body:
hi, i try to make a select imput with options group but i get this error

`htmlspecialchars() expects parameter 1 to be string, array given (View: C:\xampp\htdocs\webApp_Atlas\resources\views\partials\form\select.blade.php)`

and the array

`array:2 [▼
  0 => array:1 [▼
    "Administración" => array:6 [▼
      "506524b5311d80c0fe2f7477d9476947" => "*Inicio*"
      "d8d953123ce0c43a5e0eadae53b76f7b" => "Usuarios"
      "9f40dc4c98a76ddfffda9061d4f2df37" => "Roles"
      "ee4e98f6a1a161b645c5855fe807c4ea" => "Navegación"
      "7114f3f0dd23c44b371f33ab7e0decfa" => "Historial"
      "0e8e9358840527d11de81e09f35ceceb" => "General"
    ]
1 => array:1 [▼
    "Compañia" => array:7 [▼
      "49f131a4612535cf4f3ec0a022c0d989" => "*Inicio*"
      "c6dec330e46254137a0bee3be13afbb5" => "Empleados"
      "10eebca7ae18f692a4daad59f422b8ca" => "Marca"
      "c4027d0451cef68a19463213dd2d3086" => "Puesto de Trabajo"
      "24d6e3389518d11131a2b1662a6fb13f" => "Sedes"
      "71a81fe6e198fff83b9d0d8512e063e2" => "Unidad Organizativa"
      "5147c3ce8acef1e2c6e834f0fe0ba6d9" => "Areas"
    ]
  ]`

please, can someone help me ?, tranks

issue.title: Textarea value broken
issue.body:
Hey, since some time ago, i had something like 

```
{{ html()->textarea('subscribers')->value($phones)->class('form-control')->attribute('rows', 20) }}
```
it throws "The given child should implement `Spatie\Html\HtmlElement` or be a string (View: ..."
fixed it by 
```
{{ html()->textarea('subscribers', $phones)->class('form-control')->attribute('rows', 20) }}
```
What happend?
